text: HubDB will be the way to go although I wonder if redis could be used as well.
Can someone link me to api docs for helpdesk/helpdesk.sidebar?

Redis could be used but I would generally not recommend trying to use Redis as a database. Redis is great for quick key-value systems but not the best for storing tabular information. Postgres would probably be the better bet if you wanted to use an external database

Hi <@U07S4T5TCT0>,
You are right. It is not possible to open a Modal or Panel without the user explicitly clicking one of the Button, Link, Tag or Image. The reason is to maintain end user control over the overlays popping up on their screen.
If you're looking for how to set the UI extension location to helpdesk sidebar: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/ui-extensions/create#extension-location>
Thank you Aanchal, is there a knowledgebase API? My goal is to create a sidebar app card that allows us to search the knowledgebase
You can search the knowledge base with GraphQL but I don't think there's a public normal API for it yet like we have for the blog posts api

Hi, thx a lot for your answer
I'll try to find a work around

Also I found a very strange limitation concerning  `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` in extensions, it seems the callback is called only if the extension card is visible, not if it's collapsed within the sidebar. Is this on purpose ?
Interesting…. Won’t storing state be better as a key-value than table format? Postgres can be used yes but Redis has good features to store and retrieve user sessions, app states etc.
